name: Objectives
description: Blighted marks places where something vital has been quietly poisoned: soil, flesh, faith, or all three at once. In a Blighted environment, growth still happens, but wrong; colors sour, smells cling, and anything that lingers too long starts to share the sickness.

tableData.result: Trace the first source of rot
Seal the cracked vein of poison
Harvest tainted fruit for dark rites
Burn the fields before roots awaken
Lure the blight into a single host
Feed the soil a willing sacrifice
Break the curse binding ash to flesh
Smother the last healthy seed
Protect the one unspoiled spring
Map how far the sickness walks
Test how much corruption you endure
Turn the blight against its maker
Teach the villagers to love decay
Bottle the reek for future torment
Kill whatever still refuses to wither
Replace holy relics with infected fakes
Infect the dreams of the hopeful
Breed a new plague from this soil
Hunt the creature that feeds on rot
Offer your blood to guide the blight
Silence those who preach cleansing
Smuggle blighted grain past the guards
Convince the desperate to drink here
Hide the last untainted child
Twist a sacred festival into contagion
Nurture one perfect, poisonous garden
Corrupt a healing spring into bile
Drive the migrating blight toward war
Trap the creeping mold in a vessel
Mark the doomed with invisible spores
Steal the relic that slows the rot
Sabotage the ritual meant to purify
Prove the blight can think and choose
Awaken whatever sleeps beneath the sludge
Trade safe passage for a piece of soul
Splice blighted roots into living flesh
Harvest memories from the dying soil
Restore color to one cursed blossom
Test new prayers against the creeping stain
Offer false cures to spread despair
Guide pilgrims through the sickened valley
Inscribe wards with pus and soot
Bind the blight into your shadow
Graft a blighted limb onto yourself
Conceal evidence of spreading corruption
Tempt a healer to abandon mercy
Record the voices whispering from mildew
Abandon someone here and watch them change
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

name: Atmosphere
description: Blighted marks places where something vital has been quietly poisoned: soil, flesh, faith, or all three at once. In a Blighted environment, growth still happens, but wrong; colors sour, smells cling, and anything that lingers too long starts to share the sickness.

tableData.result: Wind tastes of rusted blossoms
Soil exhales a slow, sweet reek
Shadows cling like damp bruises
Mist coils with leprous colors
Every breath feels slightly borrowed
Distant birdsong warps mid-note
Pale spores drift in lazy spirals
Footsteps leave stains that pulse faintly
Roots twitch beneath the cracked earth
Light arrives dulled, already tired
Rot perfumes the air like incense
Silence hangs swollen and expectant
Leaves shimmer with an oily sheen
Ground squelches though it appears dry
Faint sobbing rides the evening breeze
Insects move in erratic, fevered patterns
Shallow puddles reflect unfamiliar skies
Your tongue tingles, tasting metal
Clouds sag, streaked with bruised yellows
Old wounds ache with remembered poison
Breath steams even in summer heat
Every echo returns slightly corrupted
Faint humming undercuts all other sounds
Air feels thick, reluctant to enter
Colors smear at the edge of vision
Distant laughter ends in a choke
The horizon wobbles like bad glass
Stone sweats a thin black moisture
Shadows arrive before their owners
A low itch crawls beneath skin
Dew beads like cloudy milky tears
Faint ash drifts though nothing burns
Heartbeat sounds louder than it should
The sky smells faintly of vinegar
Every surface feels faintly sticky
Whispers rise from otherwise still water
Air thrums with slow, sick resonance
Your reflection lags a heartbeat behind
Distant bells ring with muffled gurgles
Sweat chills into a waxy film
Twigs snap with a wet crunch
Taste of overripe fruit haunts breath
Breathing here feels like mild drowning
A constant almost-rain never quite falls
Dust motes crawl instead of drifting
The wind forgets how to be cold
Every smell carries a hint of burial
Silhouettes blur, edges refusing to stay
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE

name: Manifestations
description: Blighted marks places where something vital has been quietly poisoned: soil, flesh, faith, or all three at once. In a Blighted environment, growth still happens, but wrong; colors sour, smells cling, and anything that lingers too long starts to share the sickness.

tableData.result: Moss blooms teeth along fallen logs
Wheat bows heavy with blackened grain
Goats graze, udders dripping gray milk
River stones sweat an oil-slick sheen
Children’s shadows cough spores at dusk
Every footprint fills with writhing roots
Fruit splits early, seething with pale larvae
Crows peck corpses, feathers slough like ash
Rain falls thick, tasting of cold iron
Tree bark peels away in wet curls
Lambs are born with translucent skin
Graves sink as if swallowing themselves
Ivy climbs backwards, burrowing into soil
Flies die midair, tiny husks humming
Wells reflect unfamiliar constellations at noon
Mushrooms pulse faintly, exhaling warm breath
Old scars reopen, bleeding thin sap
Milk sours in the cow’s veins
Wind carries whispers of dry retching
Lichen spreads in handprint-shaped patches
Tongues stain purple after speaking prayers
Wooden icons weep clotted black resin
Puddles breed eyeless, gasping tadpoles
Smoke from hearths curls downward, seeking mouths
Thorns grow inward on every rose
Candles burn cold, wicks never shrinking
Roots grope aboveground like blind fingers
Rot advances against the flow of time
Cattle hooves leave bruises in stone
Spiderwebs sag under invisible, twitching weight
Berries taste sweet, then numb all color
Church bells toll, metal visibly corroding
Fallen leaves crawl back onto branches
Maggots arrange themselves into moving sigils
Shadows drip from walls like tar
Snow falls as warm, fibrous ash
Birdsong returns as hoarse human coughing
Sickles rust only where they cut
Bread molds into tiny, grasping hands
Eyes of portraits swell, leaking brine
Fish swim belly-up yet never die
Fresh graves bloom with meat-pink flowers
Sunlight bends away from certain doorways
Roots tap hollow beneath unmarked paths
Chimneys exhale the stench of hospitals
Lantern light reveals bruises on air
Bare feet leave trails of budding fungus
CONNECTION WEB
ACTION + THEME
ROLL TWICE
